quotes: Salim noted the failures of the WCG and attempted to pressure the Security Council by proposing a resolution for comprehensive sanctions against South Africa in September 1978.

Salim was also active in supporting the liberation movements while he served as Tanzania’s foreign minister, deputy prime minister and minister of defence, and eventually as prime minister between 1980 and 1989.
He also worked closely with SWAPO leaders during the final negotiations that led to Namibia’s independence in 1994.

organizations.name: UN
quotes: Salim was also willing to put pressure on and speak out against certain UN bodies when their shuttle diplomacy proved ineffective.

organizations.name: UN Security Council
quotes: following Pretoria’s rejection of UN Secretary-General Kurt Waldheim’s report and UN Security Council Resolution 435

organizations.name: UN Transitional Assistance Group
quotes: UN Security Council Resolution 435 (which called for the creation of the UN Transitional Assistance Group to implement the UN’s support for free Namibian elections)

organizations.name: WCG
quotes: Salim noted the failures of the WCG and attempted to pressure the Security Council by proposing a resolution for comprehensive sanctions against South Africa in September 1978.

organizations.name: SWAPO
quotes: In that capacity, he was actively involved in discussions and strategising with SWAPO, as well as in negotiations with the WCG.

organizations.name: ANC
quotes: His various roles included consulting and coordinating with leaders of liberation movements (such as the ANC) over plans and courses of action.

organizations.name: UN Special Committee on Decolonization
quotes: as the UN Special Committee on Decolonization since he took a firm stance against member states that were reluctant to act in support of the liberation movements.

Salim was also active in supporting the liberation movements while he served as Tanzania’s foreign minister, deputy prime minister and minister of defence, and eventually as prime minister between 1980 and 1989.
Salim developed strong, lasting relations with the Nordic countries during his tenure.
